alert.note: Alert for Municipality of Skagway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 17 at 5:54AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM AKDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...The following area, Near the Taiya River. * WHEN...Until 100 PM AKDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas near The Taiya River. Water up to ankle deep is expected on portions of the first few miles of the Chilkoot Trail. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 546 AM AKDT, River gauge reports indicate rises in water levels from heavy rain on the Tayia River which is approaching minor flood stage as of 530 am. Moderate rain has been observed at Skagway and Dyea this morning and is expected to continue for the next few hours. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly, especially near the Taiya River. - For Taiya River near Skagway: At 5:00am the stage was 16.33 feet and rising. Flood Stage is 16.5 feet. Forecast: A crest around 16.8 feet is expected around 8 am Tuesday before falling through the rest of the day. - For West Creek near Skagway: At 4:00am the stage was 19.69 feet. Flood Stage is 26.5 feet.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
